purpose.summary: This file is the source for the IMS Program Specification Block (PSB) named DLIGSAMP, targeted for a COBOL language application program. It defines one database PCB (PAUTBPCB) providing access to the hierarchical IMS database DBDNAME=DBPAUTP0 with PROCOPT=GOTP and KEYLEN=14, including root segment PAUTSUM0 (PARENT=0) and child segment PAUTDTL1 (PARENT=PAUTSUM0). It also defines two GSAM PCBs for read access (PROCOPT=LS) to DBDNAME=PASFLDBD and DBDNAME=PADFLDBD. The PSB is generated with PRINT NOGEN, no compatibility mode (CMPAT=NO), for use in IMS DL/I calls from the DLIGSAMP COBOL program.

inputs.name: DBPAUTP0
inputs.description: IMS hierarchical database accessed via PAUTBPCB with segments PAUTSUM0 (root) and PAUTDTL1 (child), PROCOPT=GOTP, KEYLEN=14

inputs.name: PASFLDBD
inputs.description: GSAM dataset accessed via unnamed PCB with PROCOPT=LS

inputs.name: PADFLDBD
inputs.description: GSAM dataset accessed via unnamed PCB with PROCOPT=LS

open_questions.question: What is the specific business purpose or application context of the DLIGSAMP program and its accessed IMS resources (DBPAUTP0, PASFLDBD, PADFLDBD)?
open_questions.context: The PSB defines technical access structures but contains no descriptive comments, segment field details, or business logic indications.
open_questions.suggestion: Examine the associated COBOL source code for DLIGSAMP, DBD definitions for DBPAUTP0/PASFLDBD/PADFLDBD, or application documentation.

open_questions.question: Is this PSB intended for batch (DLI batch) or online IMS regions (e.g., MPP, BMP, IFP)?
open_questions.context: PROCOPT values (GOTP, LS) support both, but no explicit indication of transaction IDs or online-specific features.
open_questions.suggestion: Check JCL or IMS region definitions using this PSB, or the program's entry logic.
